content.description: Standing start with right hand in the jug and left hand on the Gaston left of the jug, move up to the obvious 2 finger pocket, up to the next jug, match it and take the next 3 finger pocket, push to the top and wrap her up.Â
content.protection: A pad or two, maybe a spotter
content.location: To the right of the flake, where the wall first becomes totally vertical.

content.description: A nice little highball with a slightly scary top out. Start at the protrusion (low bulge) with many large pocket to choose from and work your way through good holds, past a small dead tree/bush, to the top. The top out can be a little nerving if your new so consider moving over to the right for an easier top out.
content.location: The first problem you come across after you leave little cave. After turning the corner (after bozo and the chin) the large bulge (near a tree) that sticks out is the start.

content.description: (SDS) Sit start with good hold under the center of the flake. Move right and up (at first) through pockets until you're standing on the start and you can take on the flake. Move straight up to where the capstone has vertical crack through it, just left of the tree up top. Hard for the grade.
content.protection: at least 4 crash pads + some spotters
content.location: the start is under the center of the flake, also under where the capstone has a vertical crack, which is also under the tree up top.

content.description:
The second and probably the tallest wall you find at Rogers park on the way in. Just around the corners from bozo and the chin (on little cave) you find this 25 ft. tall wall with a massive sloping flake that faces right. A lot of easy climbs with high top outs reside here making this is a great place to warm up.  

  I don't know who got the FA's here, if you see anything to correct please let me know.
